steps.title: Welcome to Vue3-tutorial demonstration
steps.content:
This is a very short tutorial, to show you how to handle this demonstration site.

>:info:_You can skip this tutorial at anytime by clicking on the **×** button at top of this window.
>You can also type **`escape`**._

steps.title: Welcome to Vue3-tutorial demonstration
steps.content:
There is a link to another page where there are more complex components.

It shows how **vue3-tutorial** handles complex components.

steps.title: Welcome to Vue3-tutorial demonstration
steps.content:
Here you can find many tutorials, which are only examples to show what can be done with **vue3-tutorial**.

You only have to click on any of these buttons to start a tutorial example.

steps.title: Welcome to Vue3-tutorial demonstration
steps.content:
With this button you can watch the code of the tutorials you are watching.

Like this it should be easier to reproduce the effect you want in your own tutorial.
_Thank you for your attention_

In this tutorial, we will play with the "`actionNext`" property.

This will force you to do the action instead of clicking on _next_.

Navigate to the _demonstration_ page.

You should click directly on the link to go to the next step.
Here, first, you should _enable_ the tool.
Enter a text containing `'foo'`

The result is displayed there.

Move your cursor over the result to continue.
Change the select to `"caesar"`
The result has been updated.

steps.title: WIP
steps.content: If you see this text it means that the feature is not working.
In this tutorial, we will play with the "skipStep" property. If you compare this one with the previous tutorial ("tutorial with action"), you will see that some useless steps are not proposed.

Navigate to the _demonstration_ page.

You should click directly on the link to go to the next step.
Here, first, you should _enable_ the tool.
Enter a text containing `'foo'`

The result is displayed there.

Move your cursor over the result to continue.
The select has already the value `"caesar"`
Change the select to `"caesar"`
You should try to re-run this tutorial with different initial values. And you will see that steps will be different.
In this tutorial, we will play with some elements that are not displayed immediately.

Navigate to the _demonstration_ page.

You should click directly on the link to go to the next step.

Click on this button.

It will create some elements for 2s.

This 10th element appears only 2s later.

But this step is able to point it when it shows up.

In this tutorial, we will show some elements that needs scroll.

_For several steps, to go to the next one, you should find the element and put your cursor over it._

Navigate to the _demonstration_ page.

You should click directly on the link to go to the next step.

First we will look for an element which is at bottom of a small container (**item #90**).

Depending on your screen size, you may need to first scroll down the page then to scroll down inside the container.
Now, you should scroll up to find the **item #5**.
Great! Now we will do the same with horizontal scroll
We will look for an element at the end of the list (**item #90**).
And now, you should look for an element at start of the list (**item #5**).

Now, we will repeat these steps but by using automatic scroll.

_You will have only to click on **next**_

We will look again for an element which is at bottom of a small container (**item #90**).

Now you should see it immediately.
Now, we move back to **item #5**.
We will look again for an element at the end of the list (**item #90**).
And now, we move back to an element at start of the list (**item #5**).
That's all for this tutorial about scrolled elements.
In this tutorial, we will show some special options to control what we want to show.

Navigate to the _home_ page.

_You should click directly on the link to go to the next step._
First, about the arrow, we can hide it. And there is no arrow to the main element
It is also possible, to add arrows to different elements than the main element.
It is also possible, to do the same with masks.
And also with highlighted elements.

steps.title: Markdown
steps.content: This tutorial, is to show the markdown usage to format text content.

steps.title: Basic formatting
steps.content:
These format allow to change inline text.
```markdown
**bold**, _italic_, ~~strike~~, X~subscript~, Y^superscipt^, or `inline code`.
```
**bold**, _italic_, ~~strike~~, X~subscript~, Y^superscipt^, or `inline code`.

steps.title: Lines
steps.content:
To display text on several line you should insert an empty line between these texts. A simple line feed will not create a new line.
```markdown
text1

text2
text3
```
text1

text2
text3

steps.title: Text controls
steps.content:
It is possible to force a line feed by adding `@\n@`.
```markdown
text1@
@text2@\n@text3
```
text1@
@text2@\n@text3

It is also possible to add a big space with `@\t@`.
```markdown
text1@\t@text2
```
text1@\t@text2

steps.title: Color
Link & Image
steps.content:
It is possible to add external link and images.
```markdown
[Read documentation](https://github.com/restimel/vue3-tutorial/tree/main/docs)
```
[Read documentation](https://github.com/restimel/vue3-tutorial/tree/main/docs)

Images:
```markdown
![a smiley](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/restimel/vue3-tutorial-demonstration/assets/images/smiley.svg)
```
![a smiley](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/restimel/vue3-tutorial-demonstration/assets/images/smiley.svgs)

steps.title: Code
steps.content:
It is possible to insert code.
~~~markdown
```
multi-line code
another code line
```
~~~
And it is possible to set the language, but for syntax highlighting you should add a dedicated library (css class will help you for that).
~~~markdown
```markdown
This is a **Markdown** code.
```
~~~

steps.title: Horizontal line
steps.content:
It is possible to add horizontal line to separate section.
```markdown
---
```
---
And there is the next section ;)

steps.title: Headers
steps.content:
```markdown
# Header level 1
## Header level 2
### Header level 3
#### Header level 4
##### Header level 5
###### Header level 6
```
# Header level 1
## Header level 2
### Header level 3
#### Header level 4
##### Header level 5
###### Header level 6

steps.title: Quotes
steps.content:
```markdown
>Believe you can and you're halfway there.
>@\t@_Theodore Roosevelt_
```
>Believe you can and you're halfway there.
>@	@_Theodore Roosevelt_

steps.title: Special Quotes
steps.content:
```markdown
>:info:You can navigate with keyboards.

>:warning:You need to be very vigilant.

>:danger:Proceed with caution
>Be careful and vigilant when dealing with a potentially dangerous situation or person.
```
>:info:You can navigate with keyboards.

>:warning:You need to be very vigilant.

>:danger:Proceed with caution
>Be careful and vigilant when dealing with a potentially dangerous situation or person.
---
It only applies the given key word as class name to the block quote. Some have predefined style, but for others it is up to you to format it as you want.

steps.title: Unordered list
steps.content:
```markdown
* item 1
* item 2
  * item A
  * item B
    * item α
    * item β
* item 3
```
* item 1
* item 2
  * item A
  * item B
    * item α
    * item β
* item 3

steps.title: Ordered list
steps.content:
```markdown
1. item 1
1. item 2
  1. item A
  1. item B
    1. item α
    1. item β
1. item 3
```
1. item 1
1. item 2
  1. item A
  1. item B
    1. item α
    1. item β
1. item 3

steps.title: Icons or special elements
steps.content:
```markdown
an icon :icon:
```
an icon :icon:

steps.title: Table
steps.content:
```markdown
header of first column | header of **second** column
---------------------- | -----------------------------
A cell in 1^st^ column | Value on 1^st^ row
A value on 2^nd^ row   | Another value
```
header of first column | header of **second** column
---------------------- | -----------------------------
A cell in 1^st^ column | Value on 1^st^ row
A value on 2^nd^ row   | Another value

steps.name: step 0
steps.content:
**Step0**

In this tutorial, we will not navigate directly to the next step.

The next step will be `'+2'`.

There is no previous step.

steps.name: step 1
steps.content:
**Step1**



The next step will be `'step 3'`.

The previous step will be `2`.

steps.name: step 2
steps.content:
**Step2**



The next step will be `1`.

The previous step will be `'-2'`.

steps.name: step 3
steps.content:
**Step3**



The next step will be `'+2'` (but the 3 next steps are always skipped).

The previous step will be `'step 1'`.

steps.name: step 4 skipped
steps.content:
**Step4**



This step should never be displayed.

steps.name: step 5 skipped
steps.content:
**Step5**



This step should never be displayed.

steps.name: step 6 skipped
steps.content:
**Step6**



This step should never be displayed.

steps.name: step 7
steps.content:
**Step7**



There is no next step, this is the end of this tutorial.

The previous step will be `'-2'` (but the 3 previous steps are always skipped).
